content: Yes, young people can have heart attacks, although it is less common than in older adults. Signs to look out for include chest pain or discomfort, shortness of breath, nausea or vomiting, lightheadedness or fainting, and pain or discomfort in the arm(s), back, neck, jaw, or stomach. It is important for young people with these symptoms to seek medical attention immediately. Risk factors for heart attacks in young people include smoking, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, obesity, diabetes, and a family history of heart disease. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle, including regular exercise and a balanced diet, can help reduce the risk of heart attack.
